subject: Career
title: Evolving Your Brand Through Career Stages
description: A quick, practical guide to Evolving Your Brand Through Career Stages.

hook.text: His brand as a 'coding prodigy' worked at 25. At 40, as a CTO, he needed to rebrand as a leader.

buildup.text: Personal brands must evolve as your career advances. Clinging to an outdated brand limits growth.

discovery.text: The best brand evolutions keep core values but shift emphasis. From 'expert' to 'leader of experts.'

twist.text: People resist brand evolution because the old brand feels safe. But safety becomes a cage.

climax.text: Every 3-5 years, ask: does my brand reflect who I am now and where I'm going? Update deliberately.

punchline.text: Your brand should lead your career, not lag behind it.

quiz.question: How often should you evaluate your personal brand?
